text: you might have noticed quinoa bowls
popping up on a lot of restaurant menus
these days it for good reason they're
super tasty and super nutritious and
this is a really easy homemade version
of that roasted vegetables with quinoa
I'm going to use butternut squash and
Brussels sprouts so let's get these guys
roasting I took half a butternut squash
took out the seeds peeled cubed about
two cups of Brussels sprouts this makes
a really really nice fall winter dish
super hearty now to that add two
tablespoons of oil I'm gonna go with
coconut oil because it lends a really
nice nutty flavor you could also use
extra virgin olive oil sort of drizzle
that all over the coconut oil will leave
your guests wondering what was that and
that delicious dish you made seasoned
with salt and will add a teaspoon of
smoked paprika this has a beautiful
color as well as a really nice sort of
subtle smoky heat give the vegetables a
good toss with the oil and then for the
Brussels sprouts I always like to roast
them with a cut side down that way you
get that really beautiful caramelization
turn all these guys over looks good well
roast this at 425 until they're nice and
tender and caramelized about 25 minutes
all right so while those guys are
roasting I'm going to work on the

give these a light chop you know what
I'm going to chop my garlic to give it a

where normally you would have say pine

vinegar
two tablespoons of coconut oil again

so let's assemble this is really fun so

you have on hand
add about half of it to the bottom of

looking good so this tastes really nice
warm so fresh out of the oven this is

mmm-hmm super satisfying this is a
